attributes.action: All Brexit Campaign fines to go to the NHS
attributes.additional_details:
Remain campaigners have been fined £19,000 for failing to declare their spending properly during the EU referendum campaign.
The official Brexit campaign fined £40,000 for sending thousands of unsolicited text messages during the 2016.
Labour Leave fined £9,000 over referendum donation errors.
Leave.EU and Arron Banks insurance firm fined £120,000 for data breaches.
Pro-Brexit Leave.EU group fined £70,000 for breaching referendum spending rules
attributes.background:
To do something positive with all the fines from the Brexit Vote to hopefully make our politicians think before telling lies and stopping corruption in our democracy.
The NHS seems like a really good cause after the heavy use of our health service in the Brexit Campaign.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because under the current law, fines can't be allocated to specific causes (hypothecated) like this.

You could start a new petition calling for a change in the law so future fines levied by the Electoral Commission are automatically allocated to specific parts of government if that's something you would like to see happen.
